Thanks for the feedback Bill & Misty! There were a few more in the session and I'm still reviewing the tape. These were both in the normal forward direction.

"You have meeting with Tesla"
"John Smith"

Thanks again,
Dave

--- bulletbabea@... wrote:

From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Captures Using FM Manual Sweep Tuning and Analog VCR
Date: Mon, 21 May 2007 22:48:23 -0700 (PDT)

Hey Dave!
   
  Great captures I can hear those very easily.
   
  Misty

RetroCom <vfp19968@...> wrote:
          A common, basic VHS VCR can be used as a low noise analog recorder. I supplied a crystal microphone and audio pre-amplifier and fed this into the 'audio in' on the VCR. Playback can be monitored on a TV set or the audio out can be fed to a computer. I post processed in ClearVoice to remove a slight 60hz hum and reduce the high frequencies. Background sound was provided by a high speed manual sweep tune of an FM broadcast radio. Here's a couple of the best so far.

"Time for amazing voices"

This was a reverse playback capture "Hey David.....I'm grounded"

Thanks for listening,
Dave
